title: Job Openings at De Royal Drinkables and Refreshments Limited
keyword: de royal drinkables and refreshments limited
content:
De Royal Drinkables and Refreshments Limited - Our water draws its cool, crisp character from a long, patient journey deep beneath the Nigerian earth. It begins as rainfall and gradually seeps through layers of soil, sand, and mineral-rich rock. Along the way, it’s naturally filtered—cleansed of impurities while gathering essential minerals that give it a refreshing and balanced taste.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Electrical Technician

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and motivated Electrical Technician with a background in Instrumentation & Control or Power Systems to join our technical team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for installing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and repairing electrical systems and equipment to ensure smooth operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Carry out electrical installation, troubleshooting, and repairs of machines and equipment.
	Perform routine preventive maintenance to minimize downtime.
	Monitor and calibrate instrumentation and control systems.
	Read and interpret electrical drawings, schematics, and manuals.
	Ensure compliance with safety and regulatory standards.
	Provide technical support during equipment upgrades and projects.


Requirements:


	HND in Electrical Engineering (Instrumentation & Control or Power Systems).
	2–3 years of relevant experience (preferably in a factory or industrial setting).
	Strong knowledge of electrical systems, control panels, and troubleshooting.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025. 

Method of Application
Inerested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.royalwaterng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Factory Operator (Engineering Background)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Operate, monitor, and maintain production machines and electrical systems.
	Carry out routine checks, preventive maintenance, and troubleshooting of factory equipment.
	Ensure all electrical components and control systems are functioning optimally.
	Support continuous improvement of production efficiency and reduction of downtime.
	Adhere strictly to safety, hygiene, and quality control standards.
	Keep accurate maintenance and production logs.
	Collaborate with engineers and the maintenance team to resolve technical issues quickly.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering (or related field).
	1–3 years of relevant experience in factory/production operations (experience in water/beverage industry is an added advantage).
	Strong knowledge of electrical systems, panels, and machine operations.
	Ability to read and interpret electrical diagrams.
	Good problem-solving and technical troubleshooting skills.
	Willingness to work in shifts and under pressure.


Remuneration
Attractive and competitive, based on qualifications and experience

Application Closing Date: 7th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Inerested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.royalwaterng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Sales Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement sales strategies to increase market share and achieve revenue targets.
	Identify and onboard new distributors, wholesalers, and retailers.
	Manage and mentor the sales team to deliver excellent results.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients and distributors.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to guide strategy.
	Ensure timely reporting of sales performance and market insights to management.
	Work closely with production and logistics teams to ensure product availability.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of sales/marketing experience, with at least 2 years in the table water/bottling industry.
	Strong distributor/wholesaler management background.
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and communication skills.
	Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Application Closing Date: 14th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should forward their CV to: careers.royalwaterng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Production Manager

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate daily production activities to meet output and quality targets
	Oversee the operation of water treatment systems including reverse osmosis (RO), filtration, UV disinfection, and ozone systems
	Ensure the proper functioning and maintenance of automated and semi-automated production machinery (filling, capping, shrink wrapping, and packaging)
	Assign duties to production staff and monitor performance for efficiency and safety compliance
	Implement and uphold quality control measures and preventive maintenance schedules
	Ensure adherence to NAFDAC, SON, and other relevant regulatory requirements
	Minimize production downtime by proactively identifying and addressing operational issues
	Maintain accurate production reports and ensure consistent documentation practices


Requirements


	Minimum of 3 – 5 years of production experience in a bottled water factory or related FMCG environment.
	Strong understanding of water treatment processes, including reverse osmosis (RO), filtration, UV disinfection, and ozone systems.
	Proven ability to supervise production staff, allocate tasks, and monitor production lines for efficiency and quality.
	Experience with automated and semi-automated filling machines, shrink wrapping, capping machines, and packaging equipment.
	Knowledge of NAFDAC, SON, and other regulatory compliance for water and beverage production.
	Skilled in quality control, preventive maintenance, and minimizing downtime.


Application Closing Date: 13th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should forward their CV to: careers.royalwaterng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Abuja based candidate are stongly adviced to apply.

title: Job Openings at Orange VFX Studios
content:
Orange VFX Studios - We create Animation and Visual effects digital content to entertain, inform, and inspire Africans through unique storytelling that leverages creativity and technology (aka CreaTech) to build a better Africa! We also train, mentor, and empower the next generation of African Digital Content Creators.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Motion Designer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-Time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Design and animate engaging motion graphics for a variety of media, including film, TV, commercials, and digital platforms.
	Collaborate with the creative and production teams to translate concepts and storyboards into dynamic visual experiences.
	Utilize After Effects to craft smooth, visually appealing animations and graphical elements.
	Contribute creative ideas to help elevate the overall look and feel of each project.
	Revise and refine animations based on feedback to meet creative and technical standards.
	Manage multiple tasks and prioritize deadlines in a fast-paced production environment.


Requirements


	Certificate or Degree in Motion Design, Animation, Visual Effects, or a related field is preferred.
	At least 1 year of professional experience in motion design or a related field.
	Strong working knowledge of After Effects; familiarity with other Adobe Creative Cloud tools (such as Illustrator and Photoshop) is a plus.
	A keen eye for typography, color, and composition, with strong attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to adapt quickly, work independently and as part of a team.
	A portfolio or demo reel showcasing your motion design work.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Training Coordinator

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-Time

Job Responsibilities


	Coordinate and schedule training sessions, workshops, and events for students and faculty.
	Support instructors and trainers with materials, resources, and logistics to ensure smooth delivery of programs.
	Communicate effectively with participants, responding to questions and providing essential information.
	Maintain accurate records of attendance, feedback, and training outcomes.
	Assist with curriculum development and the preparation of training materials.
	Track learner progress and gather feedback to help improve future training sessions.
	Help onboard new instructors and participants to the Academy processes and tools.
	Collaborate with the Academy team to organize special events, guest lectures, and community-building activities.


Requirements


	Certificate or Degree in Education, Human Resources, Business Administration, or a similar area is preferred.
	At least 1 year of experience in training coordination, education administration, HR, or a related field.
	Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving abilities.
	Comfortable using digital tools (such as MS Office, Google Workspace, or Learning Management Systems).
	Positive attitude and a collaborative spirit.
	Passion for helping others learn and grow.


Bonus Skills:


	Experience working in an educational or training environment.
	Familiarity with e-learning platforms or virtual training tools.
	Event planning or project management experience.
	Ability to adapt quickly and thrive in a dynamic, team-oriented setting.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Compositor

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-Time

Job Responsibilities


	As a Compositor, you will be responsible for crafting our projects’ final and often breathtaking visual effects shots.
	Utilizing your expertise in Nuke and After Effects, you’ll seamlessly integrate all layers and elements of a shot, including live-action and computer graphics.
	Working closely with our VFX Supervisors, you will ensure that each shot meets the highest visual effect standards while maintaining the director’s vision and overall project aesthetic.
	Your role will involve troubleshooting compositing challenges and providing creative solutions to meet production deadlines.


Requirements


	Certificate or Degree in Visual Effects, Computer Graphics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1 year of experience as a Compositor within the VFX or animation industry.
	Proficiency in Nuke and After Effects is a must.
	Strong understanding of colour, contrast, detail, and a good eye for composition and timing.
	Knowledge of 3D principles and techniques, including camera setup, modelling for projection, camera animation, and projection setup.
	Ability to work under tight deadlines and on multiple projects simultaneously.
	Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	A strong portfolio showcasing your compositing work and ability to contribute to all phases of the VFX pipeline.
